You can Search Code using code search:

questions.question_text: Which of the following is an available feature in Studio? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
My answer is A & D. There's no search result for "legacy class" and Task is (I believe) a parent class, it doesn't extend any table, so it wouldn't be a child class to anything.
"A table that extends another table is called a child class, and the table it extends is the parent class" - this is about halfway down in this link below:
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-platform-administration/page/administer/table-administration/concept/table-extension-and-classes.html

comments.content: Sure. And a base class is a class that doesn't extend any other table. You can check System Definition -> Tables to see that Task doesn't extend a table. Source: https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/tokyo-platform-administration/page/administer/table-administration/concept/table-extension-and-classes.html (search for "base class")

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
A & D is my answer

Selected Answer: AD
Task is a parent and base table.

questions.question_text: The Task table is an example of which of the following? (Choose two.)
Which of the following is true about deleting fields from a table?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is the only one true.

Selected Answer: B
B. User-defined non-inherited fields can be deleted

choices.B: User-defined non-inherited fields can be deleted
choices.A: Table records are deleted when a field is deleted
choices.C: Any field on a table can be deleted

choices.A: To avoid using a code repository like GitHub or GitLab
choices.C: To fulfill a specific use case on internal processes
choices.D: To create a custom integration for a 3rd party system

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
C and D

Selected Answer: CD
C and D are correct answers.

questions.question_text: Why would you build a custom app? (Choose two.)
What are three ServiceNow table creation methods? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BEF
"If there are no spreadsheets or existing tables to use for your application, you can create and customize a new table." see this quote in link below:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-application-development/page/build/app-engine-studio/task/create-table.html

Also see:
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/tokyo-application-development/page/build/guided-app-creator/task/gac-create-table-from-scratch.html

Also, no search results if search on "Now Experience Table Creator".

Selected Answer: BEF
Bob has a great explanation to the answer.

choices.B: Upload and turn a spreadsheet into a custom table
choices.D: Use the Now Experience Table Creator
